text.3_Chapter, 3_Verse, 0_Comment: The wife of Lappidoth. That is to say, a woman of valor, zealous in her deeds as a torch afire. And this a matter of figurative language, as when it is said about a person.
text.3_Chapter, 3_Verse, 1_Comment: She judged. On account that she was a prophet and zealous in her deeds, this elevated status came to her; thus, she was judging Israel.
text.10_Chapter, 38_Verse, 0_Comment: And he did to her [as he had vowed]. She separated from human company to live alone, busy with the worship of God. And our teachers of blessed memory have said (Ta'anit 4a) that he vowed to sacrifice as a burnt offering all that came out of his house, and so he performed his vow.
text.10_Chapter, 38_Verse, 1_Comment: And she had not known a man It wishes to say, as he had vowed, so she had done, and she had separated from men.
